Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Housekeeping \House"keep`ing\, n. 1. The state of occupying a dwelling house as a householder. [1913 Webster]
2. Care of domestic concerns; management of a house and home affairs. [1913 Webster]
3. Hospitality; a liberal and hospitable table; a supply of provisions. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Tell me, softly and hastily, what's in the pantry? Small housekeeping enough, said Ph[oe]be. --Sir W. Scott. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Housekeeping \House"keep`ing\, a. Domestic; used in a family; as, housekeeping commodities. [1913 Webster]
housekeeping n : the work of cleaning and running a house [syn: {housework}]
